task.title: Creating Meeting Breakout Rooms
task.shortdesc: Follow these instructions to use the breakout rooms feature in Zoom.

context.p: Breakout rooms allow you to split your Zoom meeting into separate sessions. The meeting host or co-host can split the participants of the meeting into these separate sessions automatically or manually, or they can allow participants to select and enter breakout sessions as they please. The Zoom for Canvas Integration does not allow faculty and staff to create breakout rooms before the Zoom meeting within Canvas.

step.cmd: Select the number of rooms you would like to create, and how you would like to assign your participants to those rooms:

li.p: Assign Automatically: Let Zoom split your participants up evenly into each of the rooms.
Assign manually: Choose which participants you would like in each room.
Let participants choose room: Participants can select and enter rooms on their own.
Load pre-assigned rooms: Choose from pre-assignments or previously saved assignments.

step.cmd: Manage the rooms prior to starting them by clicking Options (on Windows) or the gear icon (on macOS) to view additional breakout room options (your rooms will be created, but will not start automatically).
ClickOpen All Rooms to start the breakout rooms.
